text: Scirpophaga kumatai is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Angoon Lewvanich in 1981. It is found in Nepal. The wingspan is 16.5–21 mm for males and 21-21.5 mm for females. The forewings of the males are ochreous white, shading to ochreous yellow along the termen. The costa is ochreous and there is a dark fuscous spot at the lower angle of the cell. The hindwings are ochreous white, with an ochreous-yellow termen. The forewings of the females are ochreous white with a dark fuscous spot at the lower angle of the cell. The hindwings are ochreous white with an ochreous-yellow anal tuft."Two new species of the genus Scirpophaga from Nepal (Lepidoptera: Pyralidae: Schoenobiinae)". ==References== Category:Moths described in 1981 Category:Schoenobiinae Category:Moths of Asia
title: Scirpophaga kumatai
